abstract: Before we met, she was my idol. Once we became close, Lizzie enriched my work and life in new ways.
lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, cleaning out my closet ahead of the new year, I found a skinny purple mohair scarf hand-knit for me by a friend in New York, the memoirist and essayist Elizabeth Wurtzel, who died on Tuesday. I wrapped the scarf around my pet, Frances, a black cat with green eyes identical to Lizzie’s cat Arabella, took a picture and texted it to her. “Remember this scarf?” I wrote.
